348.article_body: Global prices of commodities and fuel have soared to unprecedented levels amid the war in Ukraine. Edible oil, food grains, corn could become costlier in India due to the war. Rare metals such as nickel, platinum, palladium, and gold could become costlier as Russia is one of the biggest exporters, and sanctions have stopped the metals from reaching global market.

349.title: 800 employees fired by UK ferry firm in a 3-minute pre-recorded Zoom video
349.article_body: UK ferry company P&O Ferries has fired 800 crew in a three-minute pre-recorded Zoom video, saying that its vessels will now "be primarily crewed by a third-party crew provider". "Your final day of employment is today," an executive said in the video. The company has denied claims that it sent security guards with handcuffs to take crew off the ships.

350.title: Horse mussels under threat due to conservation failures: Study
350.article_body: Horse mussels, a species of giant mollusc found in the UK waters could be at risk due to unprotected areas of the sea, a study has found. Marine experts have described the beds of these molluscs as biodiversity hotspots. Marine protected areas (MPAs) were also introduced to protect them but due to conservation failure, the species is at risk.

351.title: Who is a war criminal?
351.article_body: The term 'war criminal' applies to anyone who violates a set of rules adopted by world leaders known as the law of armed conflict. The rules govern how countries behave in times of war. The violations of the rules that amount to war crimes include deliberately targeting civilians, using disproportionate force, using human shields and taking hostages.

352.title: Pune Metro to rename Bhosari, Budhwar Peth stations after citizens complain
352.article_body: The Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited, which is implementing the Pune Metro project, has decided to change the names of at least two stations – Bhosari and Budhwar Peth. Officials said they have been receiving complaints regarding the names of the two stations due to confusion among commuters. "We will soon send a request to the...state government," an official said.

353.title: 53-yr-old man gets life sentence for raping minor stepdaughter in Maha
353.article_body: A sessions court in Palghar convicted a 53-year-old man for raping his 15-year-old stepdaughter and sentenced him to life in jail. In an FIR filed in 2017, the girl had alleged her step-father continued to rape her even after she became pregnant. Her mother had married the accused after the girl's father passed away when she was six months old.

354.title: Aishwarya remembers dad on death anniversary, shares his old pic with Aaradhya
354.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan took to Instagram to share a post remembering her late father Krishnaraj Rai on his death anniversary. She shared an old picture of her father with his granddaughter Aaradhya, and wrote, "Love you eternally dearest darling daddyyy-ajjaaa. Our guardian-angel forever and beyond…thank youuu and love you."

355.title: His defence was not the greatest: Harbhajan on Ponting's 'vulnerability'
355.article_body: Discussing Ricky Ponting whom he dismissed 10 times in Tests, more than any other bowler, Harbhajan Singh said, "Ponting used to defend with very hard hands...That...made him vulnerable. His defence was not the greatest." "My bounce was something he could not play as well as...other bowlers," added Harbhajan. Harbhajan dismissed Ponting to record his 300th Test wicket in 2008.

356.title: Bulgarian Police detain former PM Borissov after EU probes
356.article_body: Bulgarian former PM Boyko Borissov was detained on Thursday as part of a police operation linked to probes by the EU Public Prosecutor's Office, the Interior Ministry said. Prosecutors have opened 120 investigations of fraud in Bulgaria involving EU funds. Former Finance Minister Vladislav Goranov and former head of the parliamentary budgetary commission, Menda Stoyanova, have also been detained.

357.title: Sonali recreates old pics from 1998 film 'Duplicate' sets with Geeta
357.article_body: Sonali Bendre took to Instagram to share some pictures from the dance rehearsals of the song 'Tum Nahin Jaana' from her 1998 movie 'Duplicate'. The pictures also featured choreographer Geeta Kapur. Sonali also shared pictures of herself and Geeta recreating those old pictures on a reality show. "Circa 1996! So many memories come flooding back with these photos," she wrote.

358.title: AAP MLA from Punjab's Nabha cycles 80 km for swearing-in ceremony
358.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Punjab's Nabha (SC Reserve) Gurdev Singh Dev Mann cycled for 80 kilometres for his swearing-in ceremony as a legislator in Punjab Vidhan Sabha on Thursday. He travelled 80 kilometres one way from Nabha to Chandigarh on a cycle. Mann announced that he would take a token amount of ₹1 per month as an MLA.

359.title: Professor of law university in MP booked for sexually harassing 2 students
359.article_body: A professor of the National Law Institute University (NLIU) in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, who recently resigned over allegations of sexual harassment, has been booked for sexually harassing two students, police said. As per reports, the students have accused the professor of sending obscene messages and videos on their phones and asking them to meet him at his residence.

360.title: Nothing wrong with it: Arunoday on losing roles to more famous actors
360.article_body: Actor Arunoday Singh revealed that he has lost out on opportunities that went to bigger stars, adding that there's nothing wrong with it. Stating that the bigger stars make a project more viable, he said, "They give the project a bigger length." "That's how it works. That's my point. That's the natural way of the industry," Arunoday said.

361.title: No advantage for MI: Zaheer on IPL 2022 being played in Mumbai, Pune
361.article_body: MI's Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said there would be no advantage for the franchise with IPL 2022 being played in Mumbai and Pune, as MI won't be playing all their matches at Wankhede Stadium. Fifty-five league matches will be played at Brabourne Stadium, Wankhede Stadium and DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26.

362.title: What are MANPADS, the defence systems securing Ukraine?
362.article_body: MANPADS (Man-portable air-defence systems) are short-range surface-to-air missiles used to intercept fixed- and rotary-wing aircraft in flight. They are designed to be fired while mounted on a person's shoulder or a tripod. The US had already sent Ukraine more than 600 Stingers – a type of man-portable air defence system, amid the ongoing invasion by Russia.

363.title: Taliban to open high schools for girls next week, only female teachers for them
363.article_body: Taliban will allow girls in Afghanistan to return to class when high schools open next week, a Ministry of Education spokesperson said, months after uncertainty over full education access to girls. "There are some conditions for girls," he said, adding that female students would be taught separately from males and only by female teachers, except in areas where there's shortage.

364.title: AAP might pick Harbhajan, Chadha for Rajya Sabha from Punjab: Reports
364.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is likely to nominate Harbhajan Singh, Raghav Chadha and IIT-Delhi Associate Professor Sandeep Pathak to the Rajya Sabha from Punjab, reports said. The elections to five out of the seven RS seats of Punjab will be held on March 31. "These are the three frontrunners for the three seats for now," said a source.

365.title: Film industry must also implement POSH Act: Kerala HC
365.article_body: The Kerala High Court asked movie production houses to form an internal complaints committee to deal with cases of women's sexual harassment, under the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act of 2013 commonly known as POSH Act. An organisation with less than 10 female employees must make complaints to local complaints committee, the HC said.

366.title: Madrasa teacher arrested for sheltering terrorists at home in Bengal's Howrah
366.article_body: A madrasa teacher has been arrested for allegedly sheltering militants of banned terrorist group Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) at his rented house in Bankra in West Bengal's Howrah district. The accused has been sent to police custody for 12 days. The Special Task Force (STF) of the West Bengal Police is investigating if the accused was directly involved in terror activities.

367.title: Congress could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat: Congress' Tewari
367.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari has said the party could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat. "We lost in 2014 and 2019...Since 2014, out of 49 Assembly elections, we have lost 39 polls. We have only won four elections...therefore we are really looking at an extremely grim situation," he added. "The situation does not call for introspection alone," he further said.

368.title: 8 cyclones formed over 129 years in March, only 2 crossed coasts: IMD
368.article_body: Only eight cyclones have been formed in the month of March in over 129 years between 1891 and 2020, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Only two cyclones crossed the coast, one in 1926 and the other in 1907, IMD added. Of the eight cyclones, two have been formed in the Arabian Sea and six in the Bay of Bengal.

369.title: Dirty Russian tricks: UK Defence Min after a call from 'fake Ukraine PM'
369.article_body: UK Defence Minister Ben Wallace on Thursday ordered an inquiry after an imposter claiming to be the Ukrainian PM called him. The imposter "posed several misleading questions and after becoming suspicious I terminated the call", Wallace said. "No amount of Russian disinformation, distortion and dirty tricks can distract from Russia's human rights abuses and illegal invasion of Ukraine," he added.

370.title: Pune man arrested for killing labourer, dumping body on river bank
370.article_body: A 36-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing a labourer and dumping his body on banks of river Mula in Pune. Both of them worked together. "One of them had sold a phone to the other...A fight ensued over pending payment while they were consuming alcohol and the accused picked up a rock and smashed the other's head," police said.

371.title: 4 held for selling fake helicopter tickets to Mata Vaishno Devi pilgrims
371.article_body: Jammu Cyber Police with the help of Rajasthan Police arrested four persons for allegedly duping pilgrims under the name of providing helicopter tickets for Mata Vaishno Devi shrine through fake websites. After receiving complaint from Mata Vaishno Devi shrine board, police identified 40 fake ticket booking websites and tracked four fraudsters through their IP address who were operating from Kota.

372.title: Letting Pakistan have Kartarpur Sahib during partition was a mistake: Shah
372.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, addressing an event organised by Land Ports Authority of India (LPAI), said letting Pakistan have Kartarpur Sahib gurdwara during partition was a "mistake" as it was just six kilometres away. "I don't know what went wrong. But when a festival of first Guru used to come along, there always was a feeling of sadness," he added.

373.title: Pant calmed down when close to fastest Test fifty causing his downfall: Hogg
373.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in India's Bengaluru Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Pant calmed down while approaching the record causing his downfall. Pant was dismissed by Praveen Jayawickrama off the third ball after reaching the milestone. "All of a sudden, he was second guessing," added Hogg.

374.title: Don't want you to be broken like my dad who fought for Nazis: Arnold to Russian troops
374.article_body: In an appeal to Russian troops in Ukraine, actor Arnold Schwarzenegger said he doesn't want them to be "broken" like his father who fought for the Nazis during World War II. "My father...was...pumped up on the lies of his government. When he left Leningrad he was broken physically and mentally," he recalled. "This is an illegal war," Schwarzenegger stated.

375.title: India reports 2,528 COVID-19 cases, 3,997 recoveries in the 24 hours
375.article_body: India has reported 2,528 new COVID-19 cases, 3,997 recoveries, and 149 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,539 cases and 60 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,281, while the active caseload declined to 29,181.

376.title: Nawab Malik's portfolios to be temporarily given to his colleagues: NCP
376.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) has decided to "temporarily" give charge of portfolios held by jailed Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik to his cabinet colleagues from the party in the next two to four days, NCP leader Jayant Patil said. "He'll continue to be a Minister. We're not taking his resignation," Patil added. Malik was arrested "in a wrong manner", he stated.

377.title: Never wanted any player to restrain: Kumble on KL Rahul's strike rate
377.article_body: Talking about ex-Punjab Kings captain KL Rahul who drew criticism for his strike rate while leading the franchise, PBKS head coach Anil Kumble said, "I don't think we ever wanted any player to restrain himself." Rahul batted at strike rates of 129.34, 138.80 in the two seasons when he led PBKS. He will lead Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2022.

378.title: Brother of IB staffer killed in Delhi riots gets state government job
378.article_body: Delhi government appointed Ankur Sharma, brother of Intelligence Bureau staffer Ankit Sharma, who was killed in northeast Delhi riots in February 2020, in the state's education department. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal handed him over the appointment letter on Thursday. "We can never compensate...the loss...but I hope this...job and assistance of ₹1 crore brings the family strength," he tweeted.

379.title: It's been really scary: Justin Bieber on blood clot in wife Hailey's brain
379.article_body: Commenting on his wife Hailey Baldwin's recent medical emergency, singer Justin Bieber said, "It's been scary, you know, it's been really scary. But I know for a fact that God has her in palms of his hands, and that's a good thing." Earlier, Baldwin said she is "doing well" after experiencing stroke-like symptoms from a blood clot in her brain.

380.title: I-T dept makes highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22
380.article_body: The Income Tax department has made the highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22, according to CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra. The direct tax collection numbers for current financial year stand at ₹13.63 lakh crore as against over ₹9 lakh crore in 2020-21, he said. "The year-on-year net collections today is more by 48.4% over 2020-21," he added.

381.title: Urge India to speak out against Putin's targeting of civilians in Ukraine: US politicians
381.article_body: In a call with the Ambassador of India to the US Taranjit Singh Sandhu, US politicians Ro Khanna and Joe Wilson urged India to speak out against Russia President Vladimir Putin's targeting of civilians in Ukraine. "On both sides of the aisle, friends of India are urging India to use its influence for peace," Khanna tweeted.

382.title: Australian PM posts message on Holi, says 'Holi holds even more meaning this year'
382.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison posted a message on Holi and wrote, "Namaste to all my Indian Australian friends celebrating the Festival of Colours. I want to thank Indian Australian community for the love and care you have shown...to all Australians." "The ancient Festival of Colours gathers people together for a joyous celebration...Holi holds even more meaning this year," he wrote.

383.title: Kapil Sharma, Nandita Das meet Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik amid film shoot
383.article_body: Kapil Sharma and filmmaker Nandita Das met Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Thursday. Sharing some pictures from the meeting on Instagram, Kapil wrote, "It was a pleasure meeting the honourable CM of Odisha Shri Naveen Patnaik...Thank you for...making us feel at home. Your heart is as beautiful as your state." Kapil and Nandita are shooting for a film in Bhubaneswar.

384.title: US Senators introduce bill to ban imports of Russian uranium
384.article_body: US Republican Senators have introduced a bill to ban imports of Russian uranium in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Earlier, US President Joe Biden had announced a ban on Russian oil, gas, and energy imports. "Banning Russian uranium imports will further defund Russia's war machine, help revive American uranium production, and increase our national security," Senator John Barrasso said.

385.title: Madras HC rejects plea challenging O Panneerselvam's assembly win
385.article_body: The Madras High Court rejected a voter's plea which challenged AIADMK's senior leader O Panneerselvam's election from Bodinayakanur in last year's Tamil Nadu Assembly election. Petitioner alleged that Panneerselvam had "declared false income details in his election affidavit". The plea was rejected after Panneerselvam countered by stating that he had already "declared income details".

386.title: Behave politely with patients: Punjab health department to govt hospital staff
386.article_body: Punjab government's department of health and family welfare directed the staff of all government hospitals to behave politely with patients and maintain cleanliness in hospitals. Issuing the directions, Gurinder Bir Singh, Director, Health and Family Welfare, said, "Ensure availability of free medicine and tests for the patients...Wearing uniforms must be made mandatory for the hospital staff."

387.title: 4-yr-old girl dies after airgun misfires while playing at farmhouse near Hyd
387.article_body: A four-year-old girl died at a farmhouse in Telangana's Sangareddy district near Hyderabad after an airgun misfired, leading to a bullet injury on her head. Police have detained the owner of the farmhouse for negligence and the 17-year-old son of a watchman's relative for pressing the trigger while playing with the airgun.

388.title: UK to deploy Sky Sabre missile defence system to Poland amid Ukraine war
388.article_body: The UK will deploy its Sky Sabre medium-range anti-air missile system to Poland with about 100 personnel to strengthen the security of NATO's eastern flank, Defence Minister Ben Wallace said, amid the Ukraine war. This will help Poland "protect its airspace from any further aggression from Russia", Wallace added. Reportedly, Sky Sabre can launch missiles at speeds of 2,300 mph.

389.title: 7 held for operating fake angadia firm, cheating Mumbai businessman of ₹2 crore
389.article_body: Seven persons have been arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly operating a fake angadia firm and cheating a city-based businessman of ₹2 crore. Angadia firms offer courier services to deliver money, jewellery and other valuables. The accused had allegedly taken the money from the businessman to deliver it to someone in Assam, but they did not do so, police added.

390.title: 2 Indian nationals detained at Delhi airport, 250 riflescopes recovered
390.article_body: Two Indian nationals were detained on Thursday at Delhi airport on their arrival from Bangkok. At least 250 pieces of riflescopes were recovered from their baggage. "Riflescope is a restricted item for import, and also attracts action under the Arms Act," a customs official said. CISF personnel on Wednesday caught three passengers travelling with forged documents at Delhi airport.

391.title: PM Modi, President Kovind extend greetings to nation on Holi
391.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday greeted the nation on the occasion of Holi. "May this festival of colours, a symbol of mutual love, affection and brotherhood, bring every colour of happiness in your life," PM Modi tweeted. "I wish that this festival infuses joy, enthusiasm...in the lives of all the countrymen," President Kovind said.

392.title: Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets killed in Russian rocket attack
392.article_body: Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets has been killed in a Russian rocket attack on a residential building in Kyiv. Shvets had been awarded one of Ukraine's highest artistic honours. "Bright memory to the talented actress! There is no forgiveness for the enemy that has come to our land," her troupe, the Young Theater, said in a statement.

393.title: Putin is a murderous dictator, a pure thug waging an immoral war: Joe Biden
393.article_body: US President Joe Biden during an address for St Patrick's Day said Russian President Vladimir Putin is "a murderous dictator, a pure thug who is waging an immoral war against the people of Ukraine". He added that the US and Ireland are working together for the first time now and "Putin is paying a big price for his aggression".

394.title: 8 workers injured as fire breaks out at industrial scrap processing unit in Pune
394.article_body: Eight persons sustained burn injuries after a fire broke out at an industrial scrap processing unit in Pune's Moshi, where used oil barrels were being cleaned. Police claimed the incident took place when oil removed from the barrels came in contact with the flame of the furnace, which was being used to heat water. The unit's owner has been booked.

395.title: Lakshya Sen defeats world no. 3 Antonsen to enter All England quarterfinals
395.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen defeated world number three Anders Antonsen in straight games to reach the men's singles quarterfinals of the All England Championships on Thursday. Lakshya defeated Antonsen with a scoreline of 21-16, 21-18. Meanwhile, PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal were knocked out after losing their respective women's singles' matches in the second round.

396.title: Real Madrid to donate €1 million to Ukrainian refugees
396.article_body: Real Madrid on Wednesday said they will donate €1 million to help Ukrainian refugees as part of their "Everyone with Ukraine" campaign, following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The club said the money will be donated to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and the Red Cross. The UNHCR said nearly three million refugees have fled Ukraine so far.

397.title: Chinese 'manja' injures Black Kite; found hanging from tree in Agra
397.article_body: A juvenile Black Kite was injured by the Chinese 'manja' and was found hanging from a tree in Agra's Chhipitola. The bird was rescued by the Wildlife SOS Rapid Response Unit and is being currently kept under medical observation. "While the injuries are minor, the kite is unable to fly," said Dr Ilayaraja, Deputy Director, Veterinary Services for Wildlife SOS.

398.title: India & Sri Lanka sign agreement for a $1-billion line of credit
398.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) will provide a $1-billion credit facility to Sri Lanka for the procurement of food, medicines and other essential items, the Union Finance Ministry said on Thursday. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Sri Lankan Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa in Delhi. The ministers discussed wide-ranging issues, the ministry added.

399.title: Want diplomatic solution to Ukraine crisis, war must stop: Uzbekistan
399.article_body: Uzbekistan on Thursday called for a diplomatic solution to the Russian invasion in Ukraine, adding that it won't recognise Ukraine's breakaway regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent. Uzbek Foreign Minister Abdulaziz Kamilov said that while it wants good ties with both Russia and Ukraine, war "must stop immediately". Uzbekistan has also said it will provide humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

400.title: I am not in favour or against: Nadal on new tie-break system at GS
400.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he is "not in favour or against" the new 10-point tie-break when the score is 6-6 in the deciding set, which will be trialled at all four Grand Slams. "Well, I don't care much honestly. I honestly don't have a clear opinion," the 21-time Grand Slam champion said.
